fields.name: Usage: /dice <input>
fields.value: This command will generate random numbers as specified by the **input**.

fields.name: Usage: /dice <input> [hide]
fields.value: Setting the **hide** option to true will cause the result of the command to be visible to you only.

fields.name: XdY
fields.value: This input rolls **X** dice with **Y** faces. It provides each of the individual die results along with the sum of all results. **X** and **Y** can’t be more than 134217728.

fields.name: X or dX
fields.value: This input is equivalent to **1dX**.

fields.name: X Y
fields.value: This input will generate a random number between **X** and **Y** (including those numbers). This is also equivalent to **1d[X:Y]** (see next page).

fields.name: Xd[A, B, C]
fields.value: This input will generate random numbers using dice that have the faces **A**, **B**, **C**. For example, **1d[1, 3, 3, 7]** can result in either a 1, 3, or a 7, and 3 is twice as likely as the other results.

fields.name: Xd[A:B]
fields.value: This input will generate random numbers using dice that have the faces ranging from **A** to **B** (inclusive). For example, **1d[2:5]** will limit results to 2, 3, 4, and 5.

fields.name: Xd[A:B, C, D:E]
fields.value: The previous two inputs can be combined.  In this example, the dice rolled can results in values ranging from **A** to **B** (inclusive), **C**, and the values ranging from **D** to **E** (inclusive).
Die ranges can be entered without a “**Xd**” prefix. **[...]** is equivalent to **1d[...]**.

fields.name: dX;dY;dZ
fields.value: Multiple queries of the above types can be input at the same time. They must be separated by a semicolon.

fields.name: XdY [options]
fields.value: Options can be specified after the dice parameters. Options with parameters can be specified like **option N** or **option(N)**.

fields.name: droplow or dl [N]
fields.value: The dice with the lowest **N** values will be ignored in the sum calculation. N defaults to 1. You cannot drop more dice than you rolled.

fields.name: drophigh or dh [N]
fields.value: The dice with the highest **N** values will be ignored in the sum calculation. N defaults to 1. You cannot drop more dice than you rolled.

fields.name: unique or u
fields.value: This option will force each dice to land on a unique face. You cannot use this option if there are less faces than there are dice. If this option is used, the number of dice that can be rolled is 33554432.

fields.name: + or - N
fields.value: This will add or subtract **N** from the result.

fields.name: rep N
fields.value: The query will be executed **N** times instead of only 1. **N** cannot be greater than 20.

pages.title: Dice Roll Syntax 5
pages.subtitle: Options that affect how results are displayed

fields.name: sorted
fields.value: Each individual die result will be listed in ascending order.

fields.name: nosum
fields.value: The sum will not be displayed. This is on by default if there is only 1 die.

fields.name: sumonly
fields.value: Only the sum will be displayed. This is on by default if there are more than 32 dice.

fields.name: hidedrop
fields.value: Dice that are not included in the sum calculation will not be shown.
